intro: Leucostegia dareiformis, commonly known as the African sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a small, herbaceous shrub that typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the warmer months. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in a fine layer of white powder. Leucostegia dareiformis is adapted to arid environments and is often found in coastal or inland dune areas.
